text: Dear <@U055S1XBLUQ> Thanks for your reply. However I am not using try/catch or any other retry mechanisms

Reminder: Did you know you can message <@U02162GK9SP|sprocky> at any time to get HubSpot development questions answered? It’s an experimental chat bot built to tackle developer questions. It won’t read your code, but can answer a lot of questions about building on the HubSpot platform.

Hey here, not sure that it's the right canal, so let me know if I should re-post it elsewhere :slightly_smiling_face:
Has anyone tried to code a custom checkout page on *Stripe* based on the line items infos in HubSpot ?

Any one here have have encountered the issue when creating an AWS appflow connecting to HubSpot - `Resource handler returned message: "Error authenticating to connector: Encountered authentication error while retrieving metadata. Error details: Status Code: 400 : {"status":"BAD_REFRESH_TOKEN","message":"missing or invalid refresh token","correlationId":"65e7578a-aaab-40c5-8e22-244438c77aaf"} {requestUri=<https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token>, instanceUrl=null} (Service: null; Status Code: 400; Error Code: Client; Request ID: null; Proxy: null) (Service: Appflow, Status Code: 401, Request ID: 3d0f584d-b222-465d-8270-0d2becb7d5b1)" (RequestToken: c26650ed-b900-67ac-077a-fb312485d5e7, HandlerErrorCode: InvalidCredentials)` . In the app, used redirect url - `<https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/appflow/oauth>` . it used to work, but this is popping up in the later attemps. any changes we should be aware? <@U02162GK9SP> <@UFBNA9K9A>

I have been through the HubSpot API documentation and the one thing that is missing is a visual representation (screenshots) of what each endpoint can offer.
I am looking for a way to show the complete inbox feed (the aggregate of all forms, inboxes, chat etc) that my receptionist might see as they work in the inbox each day. Which endpoint is most appropriate for this?
